title: Israel Launches Deadly West Bank Operation As Gaza War Drags On
content: Israel launched a large-scale military operation today in the West Bank, where the army said it killed nine Palestinian fighters, while the nearly 11-month Gaza war showed no signs of abating.
summary: Israel launched a large-scale military operation today in the West Bank, where the army said it killed nine Palestinian fighters, while the nearly 11-month Gaza war showed no signs of abating.

title: 92 US Citizens Banned From Entering Russia: Report
content: Russia said Wednesday it had banned another 92 US citizens from entering its territory, listing names of reporters from the Wall Street Journal, New York Times and Washington Post.
summary: Russia said Wednesday it had banned another 92 US citizens from entering its territory, listing names of reporters from the Wall Street Journal, New York Times and Washington Post.

title: Historic Mission Featuring First-Ever Private Spacewalk Postponed By SpaceX
content: SpaceX postponed once more its attempt at launching a daring orbital expedition featuring an all-civilian crew that is aiming to carry out the first-ever spacewalk by private citizens.
summary: SpaceX postponed once more its attempt at launching a daring orbital expedition featuring an all-civilian crew that is aiming to carry out the first-ever spacewalk by private citizens.

title: Boy Shatters 3,500-Year-Old Bronze Age Jar At Israel Museum
content: A four year old boy accidentally shattered a rare bronze age jar that was on display at an archaeological museum in Haifa, Israel.
summary: A four year old boy accidentally shattered a rare bronze age jar that was on display at an archaeological museum in Haifa, Israel.

title: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov To Appear In Paris Court: Report
content: Telegram founder and chief Pavel Durov was headed to court in Paris Wednesday where he could be formally charged, after his initial arrest period for questioning came to an end, a source familiar with the case told AFP.
summary: Telegram founder and chief Pavel Durov was headed to court in Paris Wednesday where he could be formally charged, after his initial arrest period for questioning came to an end, a source familiar with the case told AFP.

title: Man Posing As Teen YouTuber Jailed For "World's Worst Sextortion"
content: Rasheed manipulated over 250 victims around the globe into performing explicit acts on camera.
summary: Rasheed manipulated over 250 victims around the globe into performing explicit acts on camera.

title: Donald Trump Staff Had Physical Altercation Army Cemetery Official: Report
content: Two members of Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's campaign staff had a "verbal and physical altercation" with an Arlington National Cemetery official during a visit by Trump this week, NPR reported on Tuesday.
summary: Two members of Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's campaign staff had a "verbal and physical altercation" with an Arlington National Cemetery official during a visit by Trump this week, NPR reported on Tuesday.

title: All You Need To Know About Jenin: Hotbed Of Israel-Palestine Conflict
content: The city of Jenin, a Palestinian militant stronghold in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, has been a hotbed of conflict between the Israeli military and Palestinians in recent years.
summary: The city of Jenin, a Palestinian militant stronghold in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, has been a hotbed of conflict between the Israeli military and Palestinians in recent years.

title: Vietnam Police Bust Baby Trafficking Gang That Smuggled 16 Newborns: Report
content: Police in Vietnam have arrested more than a dozen people in connection with a baby smuggling ring that trafficked 16 newborns across several cities and provinces in the country.
summary: Police in Vietnam have arrested more than a dozen people in connection with a baby smuggling ring that trafficked 16 newborns across several cities and provinces in the country.

title: Round-The-Clock Search For Indian Woman Who Vanished In Malaysia Sinkhole
content: Five days since an Indian woman, Vijaya Lakshmi Gali, disappeared in a sinkhole in Malaysia, authorities in Kuala Lumpur are continuing their round-the-clock search and rescue operation in an attempt to find her.
summary: Five days since an Indian woman, Vijaya Lakshmi Gali, disappeared in a sinkhole in Malaysia, authorities in Kuala Lumpur are continuing their round-the-clock search and rescue operation in an attempt to find her.

title: Thousands Urged to Evacuate Amid Fears of "Violent" Typhoon in Japan
content: Japan braced Wednesday for its strongest typhoon of the year, with authorities advising tens of thousands of people to evacuate and issuing the highest warning level for wind and storm surges on the main southern island of Kyushu.
summary: Japan braced Wednesday for its strongest typhoon of the year, with authorities advising tens of thousands of people to evacuate and issuing the highest warning level for wind and storm surges on the main southern island of Kyushu.

title: Bangladeshi Journalist Found Dead In Dhaka Lake, Had Said "Better To Die..."
content: A Bangladeshi TV journalist was found dead in a lake in the country's capital Dhaka today, according to the local media. The body of the journalist, identified as Sarah Rahanuma, 32, was found floating in Dhaka's Hatirjheel lake.
summary: A Bangladeshi TV journalist was found dead in a lake in the country's capital Dhaka today, according to the local media. The body of the journalist, identified as Sarah Rahanuma, 32, was found floating in Dhaka's Hatirjheel lake.

title: Bangladesh Lifts Ban Imposed On Jamaat-e-Islami Party By Sheikh Hasina
content: Bangladesh's caretaker government revoked a ban on the country's main Islamic party and its affiliated groups on Wednesday, saying it has not found evidence of their involvement in "terrorist activities".
summary: Bangladesh's caretaker government revoked a ban on the country's main Islamic party and its affiliated groups on Wednesday, saying it has not found evidence of their involvement in "terrorist activities".

title: "She's Mentally Weak": Lawyer Of Pak Woman Caught Smiling After Killing 2
content: The Pakistani woman, who mowed down two people with her Toyota Land Cruiser in Karachi, is "mentally weak", her lawyer has said. Natasha Danish, after the incident, was caught on camera with an unsettling smile on her face.
summary: The Pakistani woman, who mowed down two people with her Toyota Land Cruiser in Karachi, is "mentally weak", her lawyer has said. Natasha Danish, after the incident, was caught on camera with an unsettling smile on her face.

title: Over 200 Former Republican Presidential Staffers Endorse Harris Over Trump
content: Donald Trump has faced a jolt from within the Republican party. More than 200 Republicans who previously worked for former US President George W Bush have written an open letter endorsing Kamala Harris for the top post instead of Donald Trump.
summary: Donald Trump has faced a jolt from within the Republican party. More than 200 Republicans who previously worked for former US President George W Bush have written an open letter endorsing Kamala Harris for the top post instead of Donald Trump.

title: 'Deadpool Killer' Wade Wilson Gets Death For "Cruelly" Slaughtering 2
content: A Florida man, who was convicted of killing two women earlier this year, has been sentenced to death. Wade Wilson, known as the "Deadpool Killer", strangled and killed the women in 2019.
summary: A Florida man, who was convicted of killing two women earlier this year, has been sentenced to death. Wade Wilson, known as the "Deadpool Killer", strangled and killed the women in 2019.

title: Rare Mosquito Disease Where 1 In 3 People Die Has US State On Alert
content: A person in the northeastern US state of New Hampshire has died after contracting the very rare mosquito-borne eastern equine encephalitis (EEE) virus, health authorities have announced.
summary: A person in the northeastern US state of New Hampshire has died after contracting the very rare mosquito-borne eastern equine encephalitis (EEE) virus, health authorities have announced.

title: US Man Dies From Rare Mosquito Borne Virus, Officials Alarmed

title: Kamala Harris Or Donald Trump? Why One US County Matters Most In US Polls
content: Voters in Maricopa County, the largest in the US swing state of Arizona, will play a key role in deciding whether Kamala Harris or Donald Trump wins the White House in November.
summary: Voters in Maricopa County, the largest in the US swing state of Arizona, will play a key role in deciding whether Kamala Harris or Donald Trump wins the White House in November.
